|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43684;BROADCOM, BCM43684KRFBG, TK1830 P21, 7CK-05 B2 W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac/ax |axqam2 = 4804 |rad2ax = 2402 |acqam2 = 2167 |rad2ac = 1733 |rad2n = 600 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|rad3chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43684;BROADCOM, BCM43684KRFBG, TK1830 P21, 7CK-05 B2 W; |rad3oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad3_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad3txchains = 4 |rad3rxchains = 4 |rad3sstreams = 4 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac/ax |axqam3 = 4804 |rad3ax = 2402 |acqam3 = 2167 |rad3ac = 1733 |rad3n = 600 |rad3a = 54 |rad3freq = 5 |rad3correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad3cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "101000ZAX11000 Rev1.0sp3" (is similar) is silkscreened on the board.
*Web GUI: http://tplinkwifi.net
<small>Announcements initially claimed that this was called the Archer AX1000 and that it is :a tri-band device with 8x8 MU-MIMO and maximum speeds of 10.747 Gbps. Some of these announcements have now been updated to call the device the AX11000 :and at least one article has been changed to say that the device offers 4x4 MU-MIMO. At least one announcement says that there are three co-processors to offload work from :the CPU which is supposedly a quad-core running at 1.8GHz. This suggests a [[Broadcom]] design with two 4x4:4 5GHz radios and 160MHz channel bandwidth.</small>
==Links of Interest== *[https://www.tp-link.com/ro/news-details-18054.html ''TP-LINK Archer AX6000 and AX11000 Routers Series'' on '''TP-LINK'''] (RO) *[https://www.anandtech.com/show/13697/tplink-announces-archer-ax6000-and-ax11000-wifi-6-80211ax-routers ''TP-LINK Archer AX6000 and AX11000 Wi-Fi 6 Routers'' on '''AnandTech''']
